alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Haralson; Paulding; Polk (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Paulding, Haralson, Carroll and southwestern Polk Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1230 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Borden Springs to Edwardsville to near Chalafinnee, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Dallas, Buchanan, Villa Rica, Bremen, Temple, Tallapoosa, Bowdon, Mount Zion, Waco, Roopville, Yorkville, Esom Hill, Seaton Lake, Clem, Abilene, Draketown, John Tanner State Park, Eubank Lake and Bowdon Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for northwestern Georgia.
